result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Lee Bree was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim.
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. 
Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Shall undergo a mental health assessment and follow through with any counseling/treatment as directed. 
Shall be actively involved in counseling/treatment.
Shall undergo and follow through with domestic violence counseling as directed by agent and/or Shall undergo anger management counseling and follow through as directed.
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling/treatment as directed by agent.
Shall submit to UAs as directed by agent.

records.addlTxt:
10:12 AM Defendant Daniel Lee Bree in court, in custody.   Attorney Teri Strohschein in court for Daniel Lee Bree.  Attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim, J.C. appears by zoom.  There are no corrections to PSI.  Victim makes statement.  Attorney Pack heard on sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Strohschein heard.  Defendant makes statement. Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

Count 1
1 year 6 mos IC
2 years ES
not eligible for ERP or SAP

conditions of extended supervision: (as listed in PSI)
no contact w/victim
absolute sobriety
no bars, taverns, liquor stores
no contact w/anyone using/selling/possession or under the influence of any illegal drugs or illegally obtained prescription medications
AODA and follow through  
mental health assessment - actively involve in counseling/treatment
domestic violence and/or anger management counseling
any additional counseling/treatment per agent
submit to UA's
payment of restitution and court costs
maintain full time employment
provide DNA sample

Parties stipulate to 164 days jail credit
Sentencing hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.
and Stipulation for Cont. of SEH
and Stipulation for Cont. of SEH

Prior: 203 Norma Drive, Watertown, WI 53098

11:04 AM Defendant Daniel Lee Bree in court, in custody.  Attorney Teri Strohschein in court for Daniel Lee Bree.  Attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for State of Wisconsin. State is in compliance with Victim Rights.  State and the Defendant have reached an agreement. Court reviews agreement and possible penalties with Defendant. Defendant pleads GUILTY to Count 1- Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm (Domestic Abuse). Court reviews PQWOR with Defendant. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant GUILTY of Count 1 and Count 2-DC/Domestic: DISMISSED & READ IN. As per the request of the State and Attorney Strohschein the Court Orders a PSI.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on August 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Motion hearing on June 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:56 AM Prosecuting attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel Lee Bree in court, in custody.  Attorney Teri Strohschein in court for Daniel Lee Bree. Detective Reitz s/t. Atty Strohschein heard. ADA Pack heard. Court heard and finds probable cause; binds over to Br 2. Parties wish to proceed to Arraignment. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't. Atty Stroschein heard; speedy trial demand - parties to contact Br 2 later today to schedule Jury Trial.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, their residence or family. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. Defendant shall not go on the premises at victim residence. Defendant may go to the residence at issue one time in the company of a uniformed law enforcement officer to retrieve his/her personal property. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

Minutes in 22CM79 & 22CF156 - 
10:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Anne Kunisch in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel Lee Bree in court, in custody.  Attorney Teri Strohschein in court for Daniel Lee Bree. Discussion held. Court takes recess to allow parties to discuss status.
11:09 AM Back on record. Appearances same. ADA Pack now appears. Discussion held. Amended Complaint filed adding Felony Count. Court dismisses 22CM79. Court will do Initial Appearance for new CF case, will be numbered 22CF156. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $5,000 Cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, their residence or family. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. Defendant shall not go on the premises at victim residence. Defendant may go to the residence at issue one time in the company of a uniformed law enforcement officer to retrieve his/her personal property. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
